data.title: Neural interfaces: Connecting humans and artificial intelligence
data.description: Thomas Reardon offers an overview of brain-machine interface (BMI) technology and shares CTRL-Labs’s transformative and noninvasive neural interface approach.

data.title: Hybrid bio-opto-electronics for AI
data.description: George Church discusses the IARPA MICrONS project, which aims to revolutionize machine learning by reverse-engineering the algorithms of the brain.

data.title: Highlights from the Artificial Intelligence Conference in New York 2018
data.description: Watch highlights covering artificial intelligence, machine learning, automation, and more. From the Artificial Intelligence Conference in New York 2018.

data.title: Increasing business results through AI in the entertainment industry
data.description: Fiaz Mohammed and Justin Herz discuss how artificial intelligence can improve content discovery and monetization

data.title: Understanding automation
data.description: Ben Lorica and Roger Chen discuss the state of reinforcement learning and automation.

data.title: Autonomy and human-AI interaction
data.description: Manuela Veloso looks at the role humans can play in autonomy-based AI interactions and the underlying challenges to AI.

data.title: Intel AI for the enterprise ecosystem
data.description: Fiaz Mohamed explains how Intel AI solves today’s business problems.

data.title: Fireside chat with Peter Norvig and Kavya Kopparapu
data.description: Kavya Kopparapu shares her inspiration for starting GirlsComputingLeague.

data.title: The frontiers of machine learning and AI
data.description: Zoubin Ghahramani discusses recent advances in artificial intelligence, highlighting research in deep learning, probabilistic programming, Bayesian optimization, and AI for data science.

data.title: Teaching and implementing data science and AI in the enterprise
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Jerry Overton on organizing data teams, agile experimentation, and the importance of ethics in data science.

data.title: The importance of transparency and user control in machine learning
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Guillaume Chaslot on bias and extremism in content recommendations.

data.title: Data engineers vs. data scientists
data.description: The two positions are not interchangeable—and misperceptions of their roles can hurt teams and compromise productivity.

data.title: 4 things business leaders should know as they explore AI and deep learning
data.description: Our survey reveals how organizations are using tools, techniques, and training to apply AI through deep learning.

data.title: What machine learning engineers need to know
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Jesse Anderson and Paco Nathan on organizing data teams and next-generation messaging with Apache Pulsar.

data.title: How to train and deploy deep learning at scale
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Ameet Talwalkar on large-scale machine learning.

data.title: Sprouted clams and stanky bean: When machine learning makes mistakes
data.description: Using silly data sets as examples, Janelle Shane talks about ways that algorithms fail.

data.title: Highlights from the Strata Data Conference in San Jose 2018
data.description: Watch highlights covering machine learning, business intelligence, data privacy, and more. From the Strata Data Conference in San Jose 2018.

data.title: Merging human and machine learning for everyday solutions
data.description: Li Fan shows how Pinterest is using AI to predict what’s in an image, what a user wants, and what they’ll want next.

data.title: Privacy in the age of machine learning
data.description: Ben Lorica explores emerging security best practices for business intelligence, machine learning, and mobile computing products.

data.title: Using machine learning to monitor and optimize chatbots
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Ofer Ronen on the current state of chatbots.

data.title: Unleashing the potential of reinforcement learning
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Danny Lange on how reinforcement learning can accelerate software development and how it can be democratized.

data.title: Graphs as the front end for machine learning
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Leo Meyerovich on building large-scale, interactive applications that enable visual investigations.

data.title: Machine learning needs machine teaching
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Mark Hammond on applications of reinforcement learning to manufacturing and industrial automation.

data.title: The working relationship between AIs and humans isn’t master/slave
data.description: We need a new model for how AI systems and humans interact.

data.title: How machine learning can be used to write more secure computer programs
data.description: The O’Reilly Data Show Podcast: Fabian Yamaguchi on the potential of using large-scale analytics on graph representations of code.

data.title: 4 tips to stop reading about AI and start doing AI
data.description: How to use AI as a tool in your business.

data.title: Machine learning tools for fairness, at scale
data.description: It’s time to think about how the systems we build interact with our world and build systems that make our world a better place.

data.title: Tips for jumpstarting your journey to developing AI apps
data.description: Use cases and tips to help businesses take full advantage of AI technology.

data.title: We need to build machine learning tools to augment machine learning engineers
data.description: As the use of analytics proliferate, companies will need to be able to identify models that are breaking bad.

data.title: 5 AI trends to watch in 2018
data.description: From methods to tools to ethics, Ben Lorica looks at what's in store for artificial intelligence.
